title: Photography Fundamentals
author: Creative Arts Workshop
description: Learn the essential techniques and principles of great photography

data.title: The Exposure Triangle
data.content: Understanding the relationship between aperture, shutter speed, and ISO is fundamental to photography.
bullets: Each setting affects exposure and image quality

data.caption: Modern cameras offer precise control over exposure settings

data.title: Composition Techniques
data.content: Good composition can transform an ordinary scene into an extraordinary photograph.
bullets: Rule of Thirds - place subjects along intersecting lines
Leading Lines - guide the viewer's eye through the image
Framing - use natural elements to frame your subject
Symmetry and Patterns - create visual balance
Fill the Frame - get closer to your subject

data.question: What does a lower f-stop number (like f/1.4) create?
data.answer: A lower f-stop number creates a shallow depth of field, which blurs the background and makes your subject stand out.

data.title: Lighting Essentials
data.content: Light is the most important element in photography - it can make or break your image.
bullets: Golden Hour - soft, warm light just after sunrise or before sunset
Blue Hour - even, diffused light just after sunset
Overcast Days - natural diffusion for portraits
Side Lighting - creates depth and dimension
Backlighting - creates silhouettes and rim lighting

data.caption: Golden hour provides the most flattering natural light for photography
